document.masterDocTitle: A checklist of longhorn beetles (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae) of Serbia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A checklist of longhorn beetles (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae) of Serbia

subSubSection.paragraph:

Ilić 2005
; Ilić & Ćurčić 2013 ; Ilić et al . 2013 ; this paper).
Distribution. Southern and southeast of Western Europe, Near East, Northern Africa.
Remarks. Common species in Serbia . Often found on flowers.

27 .VI. 2014
, NI (
Ilić 2005
; Ilić & Ćurčić 2013 ; Ilić et al . 2013 ; this paper).

Distribution. Balkan Peninsula, Central Europe,
Asia Minor
.

Remarks. The finding from Mt. Fruška Gora by Pil (
2004, 2004–2005
) and
Pil & Stojanović ( 2005 a
,
2008
) is not reliable and is under doubt since the taxon has been located solely from Greece so far.
Distribution. Southern Europe, Northern Africa, Crimean Peninsula.

Remarks. Rare species in the country. Recorded from Mt. Fruška Gora and the Zasavica Special Nature Reserve (
Mikšić 1963
;
Adamović 1965
; Pil
2004, 2004–2005
;
Pil & Stojanović 2005 a
,
2005 b
,
2008
;
Pil & Stanković 2006
).
Althoff & Danilevsky ( 1997 )
reported the species from Serbia , but without any additional data on the precise finding. Later,
Danilevsky ( 2015 )
didn’t mention the presence in Serbia .
